step_feedback.feedback: Good start! Keep your fingers closed into fists and try to keep your arms closer to your chest in this step.
Nicely done opening your fingers and extending your arms. Focus on keeping your arms at shoulder height and relaxing your muscles as you exhale.
Excellent! You're opening your fingers and extending your arms well. Remember to exhale and relax your muscles fully.
Great job on the arm extension. Ensure your wrists stay neutral and avoid excessive bending as you move your arms out.
Good completion of the first repetition. Focus on maintaining shoulder height and a smooth, controlled movement throughout.
Second rep starting. Remember to close your fingers into fists and draw your arms in front of your chest, tightening muscles as you inhale.
You're opening your fingers and extending your arms well. Keep the focus on exhaling and relaxing your muscles during this outward movement.
Good control in this step. Continue to open your fingers and extend your arms, remembering to exhale and relax.
Well executed arm extension. Try to keep your wrists straight and avoid overextending them as you move outwards.
Excellent finish to the second repetition! You're doing a great job with the horizontal pumping motion. Keep up the good work!

exercise_summary: You're doing a great job with the Horizontal Pumping exercise! Remember to keep your arms at shoulder height and focus on the breathing cues. Tighten muscles when fists are closed and inhale, relax muscles when arms extend and exhale.
